Introduction

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd

Setup 

options(max.print = 500)

library(tiledbsc)
library(fs)
library(tiledb)
library(SeuratObject)

data_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "pbmc_small")
dir.create(data_dir, showWarnings = FALSE)

Overview

This vignette will cover the creation of an sc_dataset from a Seurat object.

Load data

Load the subsetted 10X genomics PBMC dataset provided by SeuratObject.

data("pbmc_small", package = "SeuratObject")
pbmc_small
#> An object of class Seurat 
#> 230 features across 80 samples within 1 assay 
#> Active assay: RNA (230 features, 20 variable features)
#>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, tsne

Convert a Seurat object to a TileDB-backed sc_dataset

The SCDataset class provides a method for converting an entire Seurat object to an sc_dataset. This is the recommended way to perform the conversion since it can handle multiple Assay objects and will (eventually) convert all of the standard slots that comprise a Seurat object.

This first step is to create a new SCDataset object and provide a URI where the dataset should be created:

scdataset <- SCDataset$new(uri = file.path(tempdir(), "sc_dataset"))
#> No SCDataset currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset'
#> Creating new SCDataset at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset'
#> No TileDBGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/misc'
#> Creating new TileDBGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/misc'

Next, we’ll pass the entire pbmc_small object directly to from_seurat() and one sc_group will be created for each Assay object:

scdataset$from_seurat(object = pbmc_small)
#> No SCGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA'
#> Creating new SCGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obs'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/var'
#> No AssayMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X'
#> Creating new AssayMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varm'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsp'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varp'
#> No TileDBGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/misc'
#> Creating new TileDBGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/misc'
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obs'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obs
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/var'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/var
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/counts'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [var_id,obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/counts'
#> Ingesting assay data into /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/counts
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [var_id,obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/data'
#> Ingesting assay data into /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/data
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/scale.data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [var_id,obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/scale.data'
#> Ingesting assay data into /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/scale.data
#> Finished converting Seurat Assay with key [rna_] to SCGroup
#> No AnnotationMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrix array with index [var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Ingesting AnnotationMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca
#> No AnnotationMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrix array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Ingesting AnnotationMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca
#> No AnnotationMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrix array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne'
#> Ingesting AnnotationMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsp/graph_snn'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrix array with index [obs_id_i,obs_id_j] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsp/graph_snn'
#> Ingesting AnnotationPairwiseMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsp/graph_snn
#> No CommandsArray found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/misc/commands'
#> Creating new CommandsArray array with index [index] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/misc/commands'
#> Ingesting CommandsArray data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/misc/commands
#> Finished converting Seurat object to SCDataset

Examining the directory structure, you can see the top-level sc_dataset directory now contains a single scgroup_RNA sub-directory, corresponding to pbmc_small’s only assay, "RNA":

fs::dir_tree(scdataset$uri, recurse = 1)
#> /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset
#> ├── __group
#> │   ├── __1650544494608_1650544494608_e96970394fb543a5ad3d9c594ac619ab
#> │   └── __1650544495170_1650544495170_40f1c2bbd0504381aa2c4a9df0436a74
#> ├── __meta
#> ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── misc
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> │   └── commands
#> └── scgroup_RNA
#>     ├── X
#>     ├── __group
#>     ├── __meta
#>     ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#>     ├── misc
#>     ├── obs
#>     ├── obsm
#>     ├── obsp
#>     ├── var
#>     ├── varm
#>     └── varp

Internally, the SCGroup class is used to convert each Seurat Assay object to an sc_group, which creates and populates the various sub-components, including:

  • the counts, data, and scale.data matrices are each stored in separate attribute of the X array
  • the data.frame containing feature-level metadata is ingested into the var array

Separately, any dimensional reductions are extracted and stored in corresponding obsm/varm arrays.

To close the loop we can then read the on-disk sc_dataset back into memory as a Seurat object.

scdataset$to_seurat(project = "SCDataset Example")
#> Reading AssayMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/counts'
#> Reading AssayMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/data'
#> Reading AssayMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/X/scale.data'
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/var'
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obs'
#> Found 2 dim reduction arrays
#> Reading AnnotationMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Reading AnnotationMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Found 1 dim reduction arrays
#> Reading AnnotationMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne'
#> Reading AnnotationPairwiseMatrix into dataframe from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obsp/graph_snn'
#> Reading command history into memory
#> An object of class Seurat 
#> 230 features across 80 samples within 1 assay 
#> Active assay: RNA (230 features, 20 variable features)
#>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, tsne

Convert a Seurat Assay to TileDB-backed sc_group

Conversions can happen at multiple levels of the API. For example, we can operate directly on a Seurat Assay using SCGroup. The workflow is largely the same:

scgroup <- SCGroup$new(uri = file.path(tempdir(), "sc_group"))
#> No SCGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group'
#> Creating new SCGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obs'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/var'
#> No AssayMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X'
#> Creating new AssayMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obsm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obsm'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/varm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/varm'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obsp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obsp'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/varp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/varp'
#> No TileDBGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/misc'
#> Creating new TileDBGroup at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/misc'
fs::dir_tree(scgroup$uri)
#> /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group
#> ├── X
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── __group
#> │   ├── __1650544496835_1650544496835_09df3239f6de4630bc67327286dc2af3
#> │   ├── __1650544496847_1650544496847_97cd6f6534f34ed8b739e901dd7084d4
#> │   ├── __1650544496860_1650544496860_ee961507da9f4a869e71cec52777134f
#> │   ├── __1650544496871_1650544496871_46915f497d204d4c8a350bfc2b95d864
#> │   ├── __1650544496882_1650544496882_c01d6188fff84124a1df5ff8dd6659e3
#> │   └── __1650544496893_1650544496893_c0acaa37b66c440db114c28e9c383077
#> ├── __meta
#> ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── misc
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── obsm
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── obsp
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── varm
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> └── varp
#>     ├── __group
#>     ├── __meta
#>     └── __tiledb_group.tdb

Then we’ll pass RNA assay from pbmc_small to the from_seurat_assay() method of the SCGroup class.

Note: Because cell-level metadata is stored in the parent Seurat object, we need to provide this data separately.

scgroup$from_seurat_assay(
  object = pbmc_small[["RNA"]],
  obs = pbmc_small[[]]
)
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obs'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/obs
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/var'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/var
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/counts'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [var_id,obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/counts'
#> Ingesting assay data into /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/counts
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [var_id,obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/data'
#> Ingesting assay data into /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/data
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/scale.data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [var_id,obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/scale.data'
#> Ingesting assay data into /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group/X/scale.data
#> Finished converting Seurat Assay with key [rna_] to SCGroup

Examine the directory structure of the sc_group we can see the X, var, and obs arrays have all been created.

fs::dir_tree(scgroup$uri, recurse = FALSE)
#> /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_group
#> ├── X
#> ├── __group
#> ├── __meta
#> ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── misc
#> ├── obs
#> ├── obsm
#> ├── obsp
#> ├── var
#> ├── varm
#> └── varp

Accessing individual components

Any of the underlying TileDB arrays can be accessed directly from an sc_dataset object by navigating its internal classes.

As an example, let’s access the cell-level metadata. Recall from the matrix-api spec that cell-level metadata is stored in the obs array of an SCGroup. Therefore, we must first access a specific SCGroup within the SCDataset’s scgroups slot. Let’s generate a list of the available scgroups:

names(scdataset$scgroups)
#> [1] "RNA"

Easy choice. "RNA" can then be used to index the corresponding SCGroup:

scdataset$scgroups$RNA
#> <SCGroup>
#>   uri: /tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA 
#>   groups: X, misc, obsm, obsp, varm, varp

We can see we have access to a variety of fields and methods, but obs is the one we’re after.

scdataset$scgroups$RNA$obs$to_dataframe()
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obs'

This is a AnnotationDataframe object, which includes a method for reading the data into R as a data.frame:

head(scdataset$scgroups$RNA$obs$to_dataframe())
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpeEJmn6/sc_dataset/scgroup_RNA/obs'
#>                   orig.ident nCount_RNA nFeature_RNA RNA_snn_res.0.8
#> AAATTCGAATCACG SeuratProject        327           62               1
#> AAGCAAGAGCTTAG SeuratProject        126           48               0
#> AAGCGACTTTGACG SeuratProject        443           77               1
#> AATGCGTGGACGGA SeuratProject        389           73               1
#> AATGTTGACAGTCA SeuratProject        100           41               0
#> ACAGGTACTGGTGT SeuratProject        151           59               0
#>                letter.idents groups RNA_snn_res.1
#> AAATTCGAATCACG             B     g2             1
#> AAGCAAGAGCTTAG             A     g1             0
#> AAGCGACTTTGACG             B     g1             1
#> AATGCGTGGACGGA             B     g1             1
#> AATGTTGACAGTCA             A     g1             0
#> ACAGGTACTGGTGT             A     g1             0

Array Access

Helpers

All of the array-based classes include a number of helper functions for interacting with the underlying arrays.

Print the schema of an array:

scgroup_obs <- scdataset$scgroups$RNA$obs
scgroup_obs$schema()
#> tiledb_array_schema(
#>     domain=tiledb_domain(c(tiledb_dim(name="obs_id", domain=c(NULL,NULL), tile=NULL, type="ASCII"))),
#>     attrs=c(tiledb_attr(name="orig.ident", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="nCount_RNA", type="FLOAT64", ncells=1, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="nFeature_RNA", type="INT32", ncells=1, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="RNA_snn_res.0.8", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="letter.idents", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="groups", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="RNA_snn_res.1", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1))))),
#>     cell_order="ROW_MAJOR", tile_order="ROW_MAJOR", capacity=10000, sparse=TRUE, allows_dups=TRUE,
#>     coords_filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1))),
#>     offsets_filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1))),
#>     validity_filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("RLE"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))
#> )

List the names of the array’s dimensions (i.e., indexed columns)

scgroup_obs$dimnames()
#> [1] "obs_id"

and attributes (i.e., non-indexed columns):

scgroup_obs$attrnames()
#> [1] "orig.ident"      "nCount_RNA"      "nFeature_RNA"    "RNA_snn_res.0.8"
#> [5] "letter.idents"   "groups"          "RNA_snn_res.1"

TileDB API access

You can also use the tiledb_array() method to directly access the underlying arrays using the standard TileDB API, providing the full functionality of the tiledb package. For example, let’s query the obs array and retrieve a subset of cells that match our QC criteria:

obs_array <- scgroup_obs$tiledb_array(
  return_as = "tibble",
  attrs = c("nCount_RNA", "nFeature_RNA"),
  query_condition = parse_query_condition(nFeature_RNA < 2500)
)

obs_array[]
#> # A tibble: 80 × 3
#>    obs_id         nCount_RNA nFeature_RNA
#>    <chr>               <dbl>        <int>
#>  1 AAATTCGAATCACG        327           62
#>  2 AAGCAAGAGCTTAG        126           48
#>  3 AAGCGACTTTGACG        443           77
#>  4 AATGCGTGGACGGA        389           73
#>  5 AATGTTGACAGTCA        100           41
#>  6 ACAGGTACTGGTGT        151           59
#>  7 ACCAGTGAATACCG        417           75
#>  8 ACGTGATGCCATGA        709           94
#>  9 ACTCGCACGAAAGT        231           49
#> 10 AGAGATGATCTCGC        191           61
#> # … with 70 more rows
